result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce J. Lindgren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Injury, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).
  • Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Must have medical clearance from a medical provider and the WI DOT before allowed to operate a motor vehicle, until then can not operate a motor vehicle.

timeConds.notes:
Must report on or before January 2nd, 2017
Entitled to Huber

Associated with Charge #2
Voter Ineligibility Notice

Defendant, Bruce J. Lindgren appeared with Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  State speaks re: PSI-correction to victim's name.  No additions or corrections to the PSI from Atty Anderson. Victim, Mr. John Hall speaks to the court.  Mrs. Susan Hall speaks to the court.  State speaks re: sentence and PSI, State recomends probation.  Atty Anderson speaks to the court requesting probation be imposed. Defendant speaks to the court.  Court speaks re:sentence.  
Count 1- Court sentences the def. to 10 years probation. Conditions: Restitution TBD w/in 60 Days.  300 hours of community service, $500.00 fine and costs on each count.  Absolute medical clearance from a medical provider and the DOT before allowed to operate a motor vehicle, until then can not operate a motor vehicle.  90 days county jail.  Must report by January 1st.  Entitled to huber.  DNA surcharge, 300 hr c.s.; jail time to be determined by P&P agent, report to DOC w/i 48 hrs. of today's date.   Court advises deft = cannot vote, cannot possess firearms.
Adj'd 4:06 p.m.
to Release the PSI
Sentencing hearing on October 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant, Bruce J. Lindgren appeared with Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.
2:07 pm Court recites case & app; Atty A - take statements of victims?; Court - ask if they can come back; Victims - will come back; Oct 3 at 3 pm for sentencing.  Bond cont.  Adj'd 2:16 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
and Exhibit's
Sentencing hearing on September 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Jury Trial									Day 2-06/23/2016 
Hon. John P. Anderson
Cathy Colbert, Court Reporter
On record at 8:42am. Court calls case and appearances.  Atty Anderson states the defendant will testify.  Court questions Mr. Lindgren re: testifying.  Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his right to remain silent.   Court speaks to parties re: Jury Instructions.  Off record at 8:48. Back on record at 9:02am. Jury returns. Atty Anderson gives his opening statement.  Atty Anderson calls Bruce Lindgren to the stand. Clerk swears in Mr. Lindgren. Atty Anderson begins questioning.  Nothing further from Atty Anderson. Cross from the State. Nothing further from the state. Redirect from Atty Anderson. Nothing further from Atty Anderson. Recross from the State. Court excuses Jury. State speaks to the court.  Atty Anderson speaks to the court.  State speaks to the court.  Court speaks to the parties. Court summons Jury. Jury returns. No further questions from the court.  Witness is excused.  Atty Anderson calls Trooper Derek Hanson to the stand.  Trooper Hanson is still under oath. Atty Anderson begins questioning.  Atty Anderson offers exhibit 9-received. No further questions.  Cross from the State. Nothing further. Redirect from Atty Anderson. Off record at 10:29am. Back on record at 10:50am. Court speaks to parties.  No further questions. Witness is excused. Jury returns.  Defense rests.  Off record at 10:53am. Back on record at 11:30am.  Court speaks re: jury instructions. No additions or corrections to the jury instructions.  Atty Anderson objects to the statements being given to the jury. State speaks re: exhibits. Court allow the photos and diagrams to be given to the jury. Atty Anderson withdraws request. Off record at 11:35.  Back on record at 12:16pm.  Jury returns. Court begins reading jury instructions.  Closing arguments.  Court instructs jurors.  Jurors are excused to deliberate.  Off record at 1:20pm. Back on record at 2:56.  Bailiff has informed the court of a verdict.
Count 1-Guilty
Count 2-Guilty
Atty Anderson moves for court for not guilty pleas. Motion is denied. Court is satisfied with the verdict. 
State asks that the court keep bail set and asks for the def. to surrender his DL until the date of sentencing.  Atty Anderson objects and speaks to the court.  Court speaks to the parties.  The def. is to surrender his DL to the sheriffs dept. pending sentencing.  Court orders Def. not to drive and surrender is DL to the sheriffs dept. forthwith. 
Clerk to enter JOC in counts 1-2. Court orders a PSI and sets for sentencing.  
September 7, 2016 Sentencing @ 2:00
Off record at 3:11pm.

State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce Lindgren						Day 1-06/22/2016 
Jury Trial
14 CF 149
Hon. John P. Anderson
Staci Lundmark, Court Reporter
Atty Thomas H. Frost appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Bruce Anderson appears with Bruce Lindgren. Court calls case and appearances.  On record at 8:15am.  Court speaks re: pretrial motions.  Both sides agree with sequestering the witnesses.   State speaks re: prior incidents.  Court speaks re: his jury procedure.  Off record at 8:23am
Back on record at 9:02. Jurors are seated. Court speaks to the Juror. Clerk swears in Jurors.  State introduces witnesses.  Court begins questioning.  Juror excused. Court continues questioning.  No further questions from the court. State questions Jurors.  Atty Anderson questions the Jury.  Nothing further from Atty Anderson.  Attorneys strike the jurors.  Clerk seats selected Jurors.  Court excuses remainder of the panel.   Court speaks to the selected Jurors.  Off record at 10:16.  Back on record at 10:35. Court speaks to parties.   Court speaks to Atty AndersonAtty Anderson enters plea of not guilty to each of the charges.  Jury returns to courtroom. State begins with opening statement.  State calls first witness-Deputy Daniel Botty. Clerk swears in Deputy Botty. State begins questioning.  Court finds the witness has identified the defendant. Exhibits 1-5 offered from the state/received.  No further questions from the state. Cross from Atty Anderson. No further questions from Atty Anderson. Redirect from the State.  Nothing further. Witness is excused.  State calls Trooper Pat Kraetke to the stand. Clerk swears in Trooper Kraetke.  State begins questioning.  No further questions from the State. Cross from Atty Anderson. Nothing further. Witness is excused. State calls Deputy William Shafer to the stand. Clerk swears in Deputy Shafer. State begins questioning.  Nothing further from the State. Cross from Atty Anderson. No further questions. Redirect from the State. State offers exhibit 6-Lindgrens statement-received.  Nothing further. Witness is excused.  State calls Trooper Mike Melgaard to the stand. Clerk swears in Trooper Melgaard. State begins questioning.  State offers exhibit 7-received.  Nothing further from the State. Cross from Atty Anderson. No further questions. Witness is excused. State calls Trooper Trent Betley to the stand. Clerk swears in Trooper Betley State begins questioning.   Nothing further from the State. No cross-Witness is excused.  Off record for lunch at 11:44.  
01:00-Back on record.  State speaks re: exhibits.  Jury returns. State offers exhibits 1-5 to the Jury to review.  State calls Trooper Derek Hanson to the stand. Clerk swears in Trooper Hanson. State begins questioning.  State offers exhibit 8-diagram of the crash. Trooper Hanson explains the diagram. Exhibit 8 is received. No further questions from the State. Cross from Atty Anderson.  Nothing further from Atty Anderson. Redirect from the State. Re-cross from Atty Anderson. Jury is excused from the court room. Court speaks to the parties. Atty Anderson makes a motion for a mistrial.  State speaks to the court.  Atty Anderson makes statement. State speaks to the court. Court speaks the parties.   Off record at 1:45. Back on record at 1:54. Jury returns.  Court speaks to the Jury.  No further questions from the State. Re-cross from Atty Anderson. No further questions, witness excused.  State calls Sue Kleusch to the stand. Clerk swears in Ms. Kleusch. State begins questioning.  No further questions from the State. Cross from Atty Anderson.   Redirect. Witness is excused.  State calls Ed Janowitcz. Clerk swears in Mr. Janowitcz. State begins questioning.  Cross from Atty Anderson.  Nothing further. Witness is excused.  State calls Deputy Kari Storberg to the stand. State begins questioning. Nothing further from the State. Cross from Atty Anderson. No further questions. Witness is excused.  State calls Deptuty Mike Reinikainen to the stand. Clerk swears in the deputy and state begins questioning.  Nothing further. Cross from Atty Anderson.  No further questions witness is excused. State calls Janet Hrdlicka to the stand. Clerk swears in Ms. Hrdlicka. State begins questioning.  Nothing further from the state. Cross from Atty Anderson. No further questions.  Witness is excused.  State calls Jackie Sharpley to the stand. Clerk swears in Ms. Sharpley. State begins questioning.  No further questions.  Cross from Atty Anderson. No further questions Witness is excused.  State calls Jeff Hansen to the stand. Clerk swears in Mr. Hansen. State begins questioning.  Nothing further from the State. Cross from Atty Anderson.  Nothing further. Witness is excused.  Off record for break at 2:46. Back on record at 3:16pm. Atty Anderson brings up Juror issue.  Juror brought in to be questioned.  State speaks to the court.  Court speaks to the parties.  State calls John Hall to the stand.  Clerk swears in Mr. Hall. State begins questioning.  No further questions. Cross from Atty Anderson.  No further questions. Witness is excused.  State rests.  Jury is excused for the day.   Nothing further from the state.  Atty Anderson makes a motion to dismiss both counts.  State speaks to the court.  Court is satisfied that the state has put on evidence.  Motion to dismiss is denied.  Court speaks to the parties re: jury instructions. 
Adjourned at 4:01pm.
Waived formal reading of the amended information--Not guilty plea is entered to both counts.
